summary: FA chairman Greg Dyke wants to increase the number of home-grown players in club squads from eight to 12 . Graham Taylor , Glenn Hoddle , Kevin Keegan , Sven-Goran Eriksson and Steve McClaren have signed a letter addressed to Dyke .

aspect: 1. Football Association chairman Greg Dyke receives backing from five former England managers in his push for radical changes.

explain: Greg Dyke, the Football Association chairman, is supported by 5 former England managers in his objective to introduce significant changes, specifically increasing the number of home-grown players in club squads from 8 to 12.

Greg Dyke, chairman of FA, plans to increase the number of home-grown players in UK club squads from 8 to 12. Supported by several prominent figures like Graham Taylor, Glenn Hoddle, Kevin Keegan, Sven-Goran Eriksson and Steve McClaren, this initiative focuses on promoting and nurturing local talent.
Five former England managers urge the English game to support Dyke's proposals for increasing home-grown players in club squads, saying it is essential for the development of the national team.
